title: Europe against Anti-Europe (Italian postcard, ca. 1942)
Text:: Europe against Anti-Europe.Year  ca. 1942.Publisher  NA.Artist  NA.Additional information  Italian postcard from the Second World War showing Italian and German soldiers attempting to hold a door against the Bolshevik monster. The postcard was produced for use by soldiers at the front (the reverse reading ‘Cartolina Postale per le Forze Armate’) and includes a quote from a speech delivered by King Victor Emmanuel III following Italy’s entry into the war in June 1940  ‘United with you like never before, I am confident that the patriotic valour of the Italian people will once again secure victory for our glorious armies’. A number of similar postcards were produced by the Italian military at the time showing Italian soldiers participating in the war on the Eastern Front.
